issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: based on different versions, we may have COLUMN_STATS_ACCURATE {"BASIC_STATS":"true","COLUMN_STATS":{"key":"true","value":"true"}} or COLUMN_STATS_ACCURATE {"COLUMN_STATS":{"key":"true","value":"true"},"BASIC_STATS":"true"}
fields.summary: Make the print of COLUMN_STATS_ACCURATE more stable.

comments.body: +1 pending tests... However I still think error logs should not be on trace level. When would these errors happen? I don't think it would be too often.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12820004/HIVE-14317.02.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to 370 failed/errored test(s), 10355 tests executed
*Failed tests:*
{noformat}
TestMsgBusConnection - did not produce a TEST-*.xml file
